intro: Erysimum concinnum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wallflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its flowers are yellow or orange and bloom in early spring. The plant is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
